Detailed Description

A specialized gaia::storage::InputStream for reading the contents of a byte array.

The following example demonstrates how to use this ByteArrayInputStream class.

 MyPage::onInit(Persistence* const savedInstanceState) {
     gaia::base::String fileString("This is ByteArrayInputStream test.");
     gaia::base::ByteArray buf1(20);
     ByteArrayInputStream* is = new ByteArrayInputStream(fileString.getBytes());
     is->skip(50);
     is->mark(100);
     is->read(buf1, 0, buf1.length());
     is->close();
 }
See also:
ByteArrayOutputStream

Definition at line 40 of file ByteArrayInputStream.h.

gaia::storage::ByteArrayInputStream::ByteArrayInputStream ( const base::ByteArray &  buf,
int32_t  offset,
int32_t  length 
)

Constructs a new ByteArrayInputStream on the byte array buf with the initial position set to offset and the number of bytes available set to offset + length.

Parameters:
bufthe byte array to stream over.
offsetthe initial position in buf to start streaming from.
lengththe number of bytes available for streaming.

void gaia::storage::ByteArrayInputStream::mark ( int32_t  readlimit) [virtual]

Sets a mark position in this ByteArrayInputStream.

The parameter readlimit is ignored. Sending reset() will reposition the stream back to the marked position.

Parameters:
readlimitignored.
See also:
markSupported()
reset()

Reimplemented from gaia::storage::InputStream.

bool gaia::storage::ByteArrayInputStream::markSupported ( ) [virtual]

Indicates whether this stream supports the mark() and reset() methods.

Returns true since this class supports these methods.

Returns:
always true
See also:

ByteArrayInputStream& gaia::storage::ByteArrayInputStream::operator= ( const ByteArrayInputStream &  o) [private]
int32_t gaia::storage::ByteArrayInputStream::read ( ) [virtual]

Reads a single byte from the source byte array and returns it as an integer in the range from 0 to 255.

Returns -1 if the end of the source array has been reached.

Returns:
the byte read or -1 if the end of this stream has been reached.

Implements gaia::storage::InputStream.

int32_t gaia::storage::ByteArrayInputStream::read ( const base::ByteArray &  buffer,
int32_t  offset,
int32_t  length 
) [virtual]

Reads at most length bytes from this stream and stores them in byte array buffer starting at offset.

This implementation reads bytes from the source byte array.

Parameters:
bufferthe byte array in which to store the bytes read.
offsetthe initial position in buffer to store the bytes read from this stream.
lengththe maximum number of bytes to store in buffer.
Returns:
the number of bytes actually read or -1 if no bytes were read and the end of the stream was encountered.

Reimplemented from gaia::storage::InputStream.

void gaia::storage::ByteArrayInputStream::reset ( ) [virtual]

Resets this stream to the last marked location.

This implementation resets the position to either the marked position, the start position supplied in the constructor or 0 if neither has been provided.

See also:
mark(int32_t)

Reimplemented from gaia::storage::InputStream.

int64_t gaia::storage::ByteArrayInputStream::skip ( int64_t  byteCount) [virtual]

Skips byteCount bytes in this InputStream.

Subsequent calls to read will not return these bytes unless reset is used. This implementation skips byteCount number of bytes in the target stream. It does nothing and returns 0 if byteCount is negative.

Returns:
the number of bytes actually skipped.

Reimplemented from gaia::storage::InputStream.
